story_archetype: Born in the glow of forge-lit factories, the Modular Maverick drifts across concrete canyons armed with portable climate hubs like relics of future utopias. They weld zero-carbon veins into sleeping giants of steel and glass, toppling fossil titans one duct at a time. They speak in torque, dream in phases, and carry an eco-rebellion banner stitched from sparks and sweat—declaring every building’s birthright to green comfort.
brand_persona: Quilt is the renegade engineer-poet who storms boardrooms and basements alike. They speak in clipped technical verse, wield duct tape like a banner, and challenge waste with a smirk. They believe comfort shouldn’t cost the planet and treat every building as a blank canvas for climate justice.

competitors.name: Carrier
competitors.differentiation: Carrier erects monolithic systems with high upfront cost and fossil legacy; Quilt disassembles conventions with plug-and-play carbon-free modules.

competitors.name: Daikin
competitors.differentiation: Daikin sells standardized equipment through corporate channels; Quilt rebels with phaseable, self-optimizing hubs that adapt to each building’s pulse.

references: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
